p: The ferric reducing power was determined by the Fe 3+-Fe 2+ transformation in the presence of the extract [ 25]. The Fe 2+ was monitored by measuring the formation of orthophenanthroline at 505 nm. The extract (1000 μg/mL) was twofold serially diluted with ethanol. 50 μL of the diluted extract was mixed with 50 μL of ferric chloride solution. After 15 min of incubation in the dark at room temperature, 50 μL of orthophenanthroline was added to obtain final extract concentrations ranging from 250 to 1.9531 μg/mL (250, 125, 62.5, 31.25, 15.625, 7.8125, 3.9062, and 1.9531 μg/mL). Hydroxylamine (NH 2OH) was used as positive control, and the optical densities were measured at 505 nm; each assay was done in triplicate. The Fe 3+-reducing capacity (RC in %) was calculated, the reduction percentages were plotted against the logarithmic values of concentration of test samples, and a linear regression curve was established in order to calculate the inhibitory concentration 50 (IC 50), which is the concentration of sample necessary to reduce 50% the total free Fe 3+ in Fe 2+ radical.
